original:
The concealment of synagogues in Central Europe extended beyond their architectural design to their urban placement. Many synagogues were strategically hidden behind courtyards or other buildings, as observed in cities such as Düsseldorf and Vienna. This deliberate concealment served to comply with external regulations while also safeguarding the sanctity and security of Jewish worship spaces.


The Napoleonic Code, enacted during Napol
